subject: l2pop to always notify flood entries to agents
commit_message:
l2pop to always notify flood entries to agents

During bulk vm migrations and vm autoevacuations between nodes,
sometimes flood entries in nodes are not created preventing vms
communication.
This is because, Neutron server will identify first or last port
on the network on that agent, and will notify flood entries accordingly.
But when multiple workers are enabled, this identification fails
in server and server can't properly notify agents for flood entries.
Change [1] will address this issue by moving this logic to agents.
But that creates a dependency between neutron server and ovs agent
(Old agents from previous releases still have this issue.)

So Always notifying flood entries to agents may avoid flood entries
loss. As we are not changing RPC between neutron server and ovs agents,
this can work for agents from previous relase.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/269212/

Partial-Bug: #1555600
Change-Id: I3c6d90ddc2ffd344815279e57a2d839579b9d8e7

subject: Throttle SIGHUPs to keepalived
commit_message:
Throttle SIGHUPs to keepalived

Multiple SIGHUPs in quick succession might cause the master keepalived
to forfeit its mastership (which will cause keepalived to remove IPs of
its external devices, severing connectivity). This can happen when, for
example, associating or disassociating multiple floatingips.

The patch makes the agent throttle SIGHUP sent to keepalived: the very first
SIGHUP is always sent; as for subsequent signals, they are delayed till
agent threshold is reached. (It's 3 seconds by default.)

As an example, when three consequent router updates trigger keepalived
respawn then:
* the very first signal is sent as usual;
* the second signal is deferred and sent in up to 3 seconds since the
  first signal;
* the third signal is ignored, though the change that triggered it will
  be correctly applied by the second signal handler when it is triggered
  after threshold delay.

If the last time a spawn request occurred is older than current-time
minus threshold then there is no delay.

subject: New enginefacade for networks, subnets.
commit_message:
New enginefacade for networks, subnets.

Usage reader and writer for db operations.

In Neutron code we have common situation like:

with context.session.begin():
   context.session.add(obj)

self._make_obj_dict(obj)

With new enginefacade we change context.session.begin() for
db.context_manager.writer(reader).using(context).

When object leaves this with-block, its reference to session is
cleared because session is discarded. To use this object later to
load some data from its dependencies, we have to provide different
session to work in. To solve this obj either can be moved under
with-block or we have to do context.session.add(obj) one more time
to be able to load relations.

This change also switches to usage of new enginefacade for some db
operations with ports, in order to pass unit and functional tests.

subject: TestTrackedResource: register core plugin in directory
commit_message:
TestTrackedResource: register core plugin in directory

This is achieved by switching the test class to BaseTestCase and using
setup_coreplugin. This makes later calls to neutron.objects.db.api
functions that extract the plugin from plugins directory to work.

The test class registers some sqlalchemy events for models not
registered in BASEV2, which later makes unregister_events fail because
of failure to compare those model classes with other registered model
classes (those that belong to proper model classes like Port). Before
the patch, the core plugin was not correctly registered in plugins
directory, and no code was actually loading the plugin, so no other
sqla events were in _REGISTERED_SQLA_EVENTS, which explains why
previously calls to unregister_events hasn't failed.

Hitachi VSP storage has the dependency between volumes and snapshots.
The users have to unmanage volumes have the dependency with snapshots
after unmanaging snapshot. If users don't exclude these volumes from
managed targets, the volumes stay inside OpenStack while snapshots
depending on such volumes are outside OpenStack. In Hitachi VSP storage,
operations on these volumes aren't accepted because dependency
relationships remain.
Considering the case where users didn't unmanage volumes which have
dependency with snapshots, It is necessary to restrain unmanage
snapshot for Hitachi VSP drivers. We will consider how to manage and
unmanage snapshot have the dependency from now on.

subject: Add an option to improve the performance of attach/detach volume
commit_message:
Add an option to improve the performance of attach/detach volume

Added a new config option ``vsp_horcm_name_only_discovery`` to improve
the performance of attaching or detaching volumes. Upon request for
attaching or detaching volumes, the driver searches for host groups or
iSCSI targets that are already connected to the host.

If this option is set to True, the driver checks only host groups or
iSCSI targets that are most likely to be connected to the host.
If this option is set to False, the driver checks other host groups or
iSCSI targets as well.

Setting this option to True will improve the performance of attaching
or detaching volumes when there are a lot of host groups in Hitachi VSP
storage. Instead of improving the search performance, The users need to
use be careful with the host group name. The default is False.

subject: Disable RA and IPv6 forwarding on backup HA routers
commit_message:
Disable RA and IPv6 forwarding on backup HA routers

Neutron does not disable ipv6 forwarding for HA routers and it's
enabled by default in all router namespaces. For ipv6, this means
that it will automatically join the following groups:

* link-local all-routers multicast group (ff02::2)
* interface-local all routers multicast group (ff01::2)
* site-local all routers multicast group (ff05::2))

As a side effect it will answer to multicast listener queries, thus
causing external switch to learn its MAC address and disrupting traffic
to the master instance.

This patch will enable ipv6 forwarding on the gateway interface only
for master instances and disable it otherwise to fix the issue.

Also, the accept_ra procfs entry was enabled under certain
circumstances but it wasn't disabled otherwise. This patch, will
disable RA on the gateway interface for non master instances.

Closes-Bug: #1667756

Change-Id: I9bc890b43f750cad68fc67f4c79f1426c3506863

subject: Support required positional arguments correctly
commit_message:
Support required positional arguments correctly

Right now, if you define an option in oslo.config as both: required=True
and positional=True, then oslo.config mistakenly passes nargs='?' to
argparse, resulting in an optional positional argument:

  usage: script.py [file]

Instead of allowing argparse to require it:

  usage: script.py file

This patch simply skips the definition of nargs (effectively setting it
back to it's default value of None) when required=True, which is
argparse's assumption for positional arguments (that they're required).
